skill.name: typescript-review
skill.description: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a read-only code review skill that reads TypeScript/JavaScript files and runs standard development tooling. All capabilities are appropriate for the stated purpose. No network calls, no file writes, no persistence mechanisms, and no obfuscated code.

content.user_title: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code for standards compliance
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill automates compliance checking for TypeScript/JavaScript pull requests using established linting tools and coding standards.
actual_capabilities: Reads TypeScript/JavaScript files to analyze code changes
Runs ESLint for style and linting violations
Reviews React components for best practices
limitations: Does not run integration or end-to-end tests
Does not access external APIs or network resources

use_cases.title: Automated PR compliance checks
use_cases.description: Validate TypeScript/JavaScript changes meet coding standards before merging

use_cases.title: Type safety verification
use_cases.description: Catch type errors and TypeScript usage issues early in development

use_cases.title: Consistent code style enforcement
use_cases.description: Ensure all contributors follow project conventions automatically

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review a specific file in a PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the TypeScript file at [file_path] for coding standards compliance. Check JSDoc comments, type safety, and React best practices if applicable.

prompt_templates.title: Linting Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ESLint on all TypeScript files in the [directory_path] directory. Report any style violations or linting errors.

prompt_templates.title: Format Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if the code in [file_path] follows Prettier formatting. Report any files that need formatting corrections.

prompt_templates.title: Full Type Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full type check on [file_path] and report any TypeScript errors, type mismatches, or strict mode violations.

output: ‚ö† Consider using React.FC type convention for components
‚úì Type safety: All types properly defined

best_practices: Run linting and type checks before requesting human review
Provide clear feedback with specific line numbers and fix suggestions
Focus on standards compliance rather than personal style preferences
anti_patterns: Using this skill for non-TypeScript/JavaScript files
Ignoring false positives from overly strict linting rules
Relying solely on automated checks without human judgment

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Setup varies by platform.

faq.question: What coding standards does it check?
faq.answer: It validates ESLint rules, Prettier formatting, TypeScript types, JSDoc quality, and React patterns.

faq.question: Can it fix issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill identifies issues only. Use separate Prettier or ESLint fix commands to correct them.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill runs locally and only reads files within your repository. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: Why are no errors showing?
faq.answer: Ensure ESLint and TypeScript are properly installed. Check that config files exist in your project root.

faq.question: How is this different from pre-commit hooks?
faq.answer: This skill reviews entire PR diffs and provides human-friendly feedback with context and suggestions.
